intro: Scorzonera grigoraschvilii, commonly known as the Georgian scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky and dry habitats, showcasing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Scorzonera grigoraschvilii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
